CVE-2011-5325.title: USN-3935-1: BusyBox vulnerabilities
CVE-2011-5325.body: Tyler Hicks discovered that BusyBox incorrectly handled symlinks inside tar archives. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted tar archive, a remote attacker could overwrite arbitrary files outside of the current directory. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. (CVE-2011-5325)

CVE-2011-2767.title: USN-3825-1: mod_perl vulnerability
CVE-2011-2767.body: Details Jan Ingvoldstad discovered that mod_perl incorrectly handled configuration options to disable being used by unprivileged users, contrary to the documentation. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary Perl code.

CVE-2011-2767.title: USN-3825-2: mod_perl vulnerability
CVE-2011-2767.body: Details USN-3825-1 fixed a vulnerability in mod_perl. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM. Original advisory details: Jan Ingvoldstad discovered that mod_perl incorrectly handled configuration options to disable being used by unprivileged users, contrary to the documentation. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary Perl code.
